item.title: Force and Free Body Diagrams
item.description: Force: Mass (kg) x acceleration ($ms^{-2}$), units in Newtons (N) Vector Quantity, include direction $$ f=ma $$ We can use this for free body diagrams If one arrow is bigger, it is accelerating in that direction You can write the force as “$F_x$”, where x is the type, e.

item.title: Momentum and Impulse
item.description: Momentum Momentum: Mass (kg) x Velocity (m/s) , units are $kg$ $ms^{-1}$ Vector quantity, include direction $$ p = mv $$

item.title: Motion Equations
item.description: SUVAT Equations S: Displacement: m U: Initial Velocity: $ms^{-1}$ V: Final Velocity: $ms^{-1}$ A: Acceleration: $ms^{-2}$ T: Time: s $$ v_{av}=\frac {s}{t} $$

item.title: Physics Notes
item.description: Year 11 Notes: Science Inquiry Skills Motion Equations Force and Free Body Diagrams Momentum and Impulse

item.title: Science Inquiry Skills
item.description: Accuracy: How close your experimentally derived number is to the “true” or “real” quantity being measured Precision: How the repeat values or a given trial are to each other, OR the fineness of the scale on the instrument being used to take measurements
